titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: Esther Armstrong was a graduate (in 1934) of the Blanche Kellogg Institute, a school in Santurce, Puerto Rico, run by the American Missionary Association. In 1940, Armstrong graduated from the Polytechnic Institute of Puerto Rico. Armstrong's married name was Esther Morell.

scopecontent.p: This is a scrapbook kept by Esther Armstrong documenting her time at the Blanche Kellogg Institute and the Polytechnic Institute of Puerto Rico, between 1934 and 1957. The scrapbook includes photographs, correspondence, programs, postcards, menus, clippings, poems, school papers and report cards, and ephemera. Loose items in the back of the scrapbook include a playbill, program, letter, and a certificate from Estado Libre Asociado de Puerto Rico (1962). Most items and captions are in Spanish.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.
